WorkItem.ClosedComment:
Can be achieved using this path:

1. Create a new XLSX document with one sheet in it (for example using PHPExcel)
2. Load this XLSX document using ZipArchive
3. Replace the "sheet1.xml" in this document with the xml/xslt generated sheet.xml
4. Save the ZiPArchive back to XLSX
WorkItem.Description:
Hello,
 
I generate some Excel xml file with xml/xslt and it would be great to be able to add this sheet in a workbook with PHPExcel.
And why not optimize this sheet
For example, take all node where t attribute = str and put those strings into the sharedStrings table and replace nodes with new ones.
 
It should not be too difficult to do that.
 
Thanks !
 
Cheers,
 
Thymus
WorkItem.Summary: Add a sheet from an xml file

Comments.Message: Can you post an example of this XML file you are talking about?

Hello Thymus,

Would it be an option to follow these steps to achieve this result:
1. Create a new XLSX document with one sheet in it (for example using PHPExcel)
2. Load this XLSX document using ZipArchive
3. Replace the "sheet1.xml" in this document with the xml/xslt generated sheet.xml
4. Save the ZiPArchive back to XLSX
